body:
Comment 2: 
From https://golang.org/issue/4007?c=10
(sorry for the cross-talk; now that this issue exists, let's use only this):

rsc@golang.org
> no, it is working. the go command requires that there be at least one
> non-ignored go file in a directory. echo package foo >baz.go and then run
> go fmt -n .
